questions.question: You have to change the sheets .......................... other day.
questions.description: Every is used with expressions like other, few and numbers.

questions.question: Buses leave .......................... ten minutes.
questions.description: Every can be used before a plural noun in expressions that refer to intervals.

questions.question: ............................ team in a cricket game has 11 players.
questions.description: Each is used to talk about two or more things. Every is used to talk about three or more things.Ever

questions.question: .......................... of them was given a present.
questions.description: Every cannot be used before a pronoun.

questions.question: I could understand ........................... word she said.
The four students ........................... received a laptop.
She kissed them ............................... on the forehead.
There is ............................ chance that we will win.
................................ of them was asked to speak for a few minutes.
questions.description: Every cannot be used before a pronoun.

questions.question: I visit my grandparents .............................. now and then.
questions.description: Every is used in expressions like every now and then.

questions.question: I have written to ................................ friend I have.
Almost ............................. child in cities receives school education.
questions.description: Each cannot be used with expressions like almost, nearly, practically or without exception.
